area.areadesc: The Activity Model - Accounting for time
Scheduling of Events in response to a demand for work

The Advisor System. Advisor is a product in the Blue Pumpkin Suite that provides scorecards displaying Key Performance Indicators measured to monitor and achieve Strategic Objectives of the Organization. It is a data-warehousing system capable of organizing data from multiple external sources from a call-center.
Audit tables in Advisor that hold rows generated by triggers. This is a holding area to transmit the rows to the warehouse via a data transformation process run externally, such as Data Junction.

This new feature will add significant extensibility to the scorecards product. It also introduces complexity from the usability perspective and from the design and implementation perspective. This feature defines a single additional dimension added to the warehouse fact tables.
Advisor External Benchmark
Advisor Goal values reduced for specific events or periods of time, as exceptions from the regular goal values.
Scorecard Key Performance Indicators
Holds imported information from QM Ultra system
Scorecards in Advisor
How valid Blue Pumpkin Users are authenticated - allowed in and able to access the Blue Pumpkin Suite Applications.
Security Model for the application that grants privileges to, and constrains, Blue Pumpkin users.

Coaching is a new application designed to assist managers to coach employees using different types of contents coming form various sources of information. On its own, "Coaching" has no content. It is a mere system for creating, scheduling and carrying out coaching sessions. The content comes from outside sources. For that purpose, "Coaching" integrates with most of the other suite applications, as well as with Ultra QM. With a single exception (file), the outside content is not imported into "Coaching" but rather, a drill-thru link is attached to the coaching session for the specific content.
Coaching intergrates with WFM.
The tables in this subject area contain the information necessary to report custom analytics based on customized data integrated with the Customer Feedback.
The e-mailing system controls sending e-mails from Customer Feedback to standard e-mail systems.
Tables in this subject area contain general configuration variables referenced by Customer Feedback.

area.areaname: Customer Feedback - Goals and Incentives or Learning
area.areadesc: Goals can be set for all the metrics defined in the system. These goals, their associated breakpoints, and links with relevant on-line training materials are contained in this subject area of the database.

area.areaname: Customer Feedback - Question or Survey Definition and Allocation
area.areadesc: Definition of surveys and questions in Customer Feedback. The delivery of surveys can be controlled by channel, transaction type and the user who delivers the service - this allocation is controlled in this section.

Data Sources for the Blue Pumpkin System used as input for Forecasting and Scheduling of Employees. For a call center application, the input is call statistics from an ACD. Also included are Blue Pumpkin Exchange tables that keep track of agents on the data sources.

Data Source Groups are data streams from the Data Source hardware, which in the call center environment can be ACDs or e-mail routers. A queue in the Blue Pumpkin System can represent one or more of these groups.
Foundation table rows mapped to External System IDs via Data Sources
Tables from Director Enterprise
Assignment Rules define scheduling constraints for agents - how agents should be assigned shifts.
A Campaign is a project that encompasses time and specific activity undertaken by the callcenter.
Employee in the Suite related to Director Enteprise Tables
Data that is forecasted for the callcenter - generated from historical data and user-created profiles.
Business Organization that contains employees that need to be scheduled by the Blue Pumpkin Application. The Organization also defines the constraints for scheduling.

Pulse displays the following types of timeseries data generated in the callcenter: 1. Forecasted by the callcenter. 2. Required to meet the forecast given the goals. 3. Predicted from the schedule given employee constraints. 4. Actually produced (historical data) in the callcenter (which is then used to forecast in the future, completing the loop).
Shift Overtime Extensions - Shifts extensions can be created before and after shift assignments to do overtime work
Rules by which Shifts are produced by the Scheduler.
Information that captures the state of the database.
Work Force Planning determines additional employees and their schedules needed to achieve desired performance goals for the callcenter.
Tables related to eLearning Competencies, Imported Forms and Evals competency Scores and mappings
Tables related to eLearning Lessons, Blocks, Topics, Assignments and lesson attempts. Also the flagging rules for QM Contacts.
Tables related to feature which supports question level
Tables related to Witness eQNow eLearning integrations.
Employees, their personal details, and the users who are are authorized to use the system.
Tables that hold configuration information for ETL processing from the Enterprise Reporting (ER) area.
Forecasting and scheduling of non-volume driven work such as in the Banking industry, where is no specific workload - ust time periods of commitment to the Project.

The Notification Sub-system notifies users of the Blue Pumpkin Suite, or carries out automated actions in response, when certain significant events occurs, such as an agent being out of adherence more more than a specified period of time, or a change in the agent's published schedule.
Organizations, and other entities that directly depend on them for their definiton.
Payroll Export and Configuration. BPX provides the datasources that are providers for Payroll Export.
Policies by which employees are paid for real work done, with the approval of their supervisor.

Recorder Campaign conditional data.

Infrastructure to discover roles on a server.

Tables containing data only for reporting. This includes data summarized from other tables by transformation processes, or created by the application specifically for reporting. This area does not contain views for reporting. The view definitions may be seen by visiting the Views link in the menu.
Manage requests in the Blue Pumpkin System, such as Time Off Requests, Shift Swap Requests and Shift Bidding Requests. Define the rules for submitting, approving and denying the requests.
Employees can bid on shifts in a campaign, and win preferred schedules based on various personal and relative criteria.
The Request Managment Schema specialized for Shift Swap Requests. As part of self-service, employees can swap shifts between themselves subject to approval by managers.
Employees can request time off by providing time-off choices to the system, and the system or the manager will approve a choice, or deny the request.

The schedule subsystem represents the employees' planned activities such as shifts, shift events (breaks) and calendar events. Calendar events include meetings, vacations, etc. This area contains tables for calendar and shifts. Imported event tables are in the Adherence area.
Static settings, pre-defined or made by the user, that are changed infrequently
Houskeeping tasks done here, such as key generation and database version information.

WFM Feature that allows scheduling of employees constrained by a set number of hour that can be worked for a set period, for example, 1 year. This policy is used in Europe. They will create a time bank for the period that has a set number of hours, such as 5200 hours per year. They will set up their target hours per week to be based on the expected and upswing and downswing of work expected during the period (50 hours per week during peak weeks or 20 during slow weeks). The scheduler will then schedule to these target hours.
The recording of actual activities done by employees

Timeseries data (also called trace) that is collected automatically, or generated by the Blue Pumpkin system. This includes historical (actual) data representing measures of performance, as well as forecast and predicted data that is generated for scheduling work resources.

Tables that are used by views. Views are very useful in simplifying queries to the database. Some views cannot be fully expressed in the data model because they have only a SQL representation - such as views based on a union of multiple queries. These views are indicated in the diagram without any columns. Views appear only in the physical diagram. The view definitions may be seen by visiting the Views link in the menu.
Virtual Time Off for Overtime Scheduling
To configure the adapter that imports and transforms Operations data
Schema for WFM Operations
Tables associated with Work Resource
Rules by which work should be done. For work already done, rules by which employee pay is calculated. Each work rule takes the form of a readable template whose parameters must be set.

table.tabledescr: Valid activities that can be started by an work resource, or assigned to an work resource.
table.tablenote: An activity consumes a period of time - it cannot represent time transitions. Activities need to be associated with an Earning Type for payroll to accurately determine pay totals. For example, vacation or personal time will have a earning type that represents regular hours, but does not count towards overtime.,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
Short, unique name for the activity
Primary key for a Table
Primary key for a Table
Free-form description of the activity
Is this a paid activity? If true, it must have an Earning Type.
Is this activity deleted? True means 1 or False means 0. If deleted, it is inactive, and will be hidden from the user.
Is this a Shift Activity? True means 1 if this activity represents primary work such as answering the phone. Only primary activities may be assigned to whole shifts.
Is this a Shift Event Activity? True means 1 if this activity can be done during a shift such as lunch, break, email or training. Only shift event activities may be assigned to shift events.
Is this Activity used for Calendar Events? True means 1 if this activity can be scheduled as a calendar event such as meeting. Only calendar event activities may be assigned to calendar events.
Is this an Unavailability Activity? True means 1 if it represents that the resouce is not available to do primary work.
Is this a time-off Activity? True means 1 if this activity represents time-off.
Does this Time-off Activity have an yearly allotment of hours? True means 1 if this activity should have an yearly allotment of hours.
Is this a Requestable Activity? True means 1 if the work resource can use this activity to take time off.

Does this activity represent a work-resource not at work? If true, the work-resource is not at work, or out of work. If false, the work-resource is in, or at work, during this activity. This will be used in the who-is-in module to classify an employee as in (at-work) or out (not working).

Is the Activity visible to Time Collection Mapping? True means 1 if it is, False means 0 otherwise. Some activities are not relevant to the Time Collection Mapping and should be hidden from end users in the Time Collection Mapping screen. New Activities default to True means 1.
Is Queue Hopping supported for this activity? True means 1 if it is supported, False means 0 otherwise.
The maximum length, in seconds, of an adherance violation that may overlap a planned event of this acitivty before an adherance exception is reported
Color with which the activity is displayed on the screen - represented as the standard 6-digit hexadecimal RGP value.
2-letter alphabetical code that describes the activity when printing on black and white media. On colored media, the object would be described by its color.

table.tabledescr: Activity resource constraint can be overridden for a specific scheduling period.
table.tablenote: As part of Retail Financial Services (RFS) convergence, the (say) lobby teller activity can only be performed by a staffer from a lobby teller booth, and each retail bank branch has different number of those booths. Similarly, the number of drive-in teller windows varies by bank branch, as does the number of sales platform desks. To support this RFS functionality, we have modified WFO so that the activity resource constraint can be overridden for a specific scheduling period. Although activity has only max resource count, the override has both min and max resource count (a/k/a chair). The table backing that constraint is ACTIVITYSPRESOURCECONSTRAINT.,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

table.tabledescr: Tracks the periods when employees do not adhere to their planned activites.
table.tablenote: When the record is written, the pay period may not be defined. It is set when the pay period that contains these exceptions is posted. Even though a pay period is an abosolute period in time, adherence exceptions that fall within a pay period may not belong to that pay period due to the rules in effect when the pay period was posted. If the rules subsequently change, the prior assignment of the exception to the pay period may not be derivable any more.,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

table.tabledescr: The Rules by which Requests may be automatically approved or denied.

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
Primary key for a Table
Primary key for a Table
The type of request made in the Blue Pumkin System, such as time-off, shift-swap or shift-bid.
is Request Auto Rule for Approval? True/1 or False/0. If true, this rule is for apporval. If false, the rule is for denial.
is the Request Auto Rule for Denial? True if for denial. If false, this rule is not used for auto-denial.
Action for approval: 'no' - don't auto approve. 'yes' - auto approve if no violation. 'violation' - auto approve if not violating specific violation rules.
Action for denial: 'no' - don't auto-deny. 'yes' - deny if any violation detected. 'violation' - deny if violating specific violation rules.
The range of days affected by the rule: alldays - All days, day type - specific day(s) specified by the type-of-days field, dates - the from and to dates in the rule start and end date fields.
The types of days in the week: each specific day, or a label of the parts of the week.
column.validation: [DAYTYPE]='sunday' OR [DAYTYPE]='monday' OR [DAYTYPE]='tuesday' OR [DAYTYPE]='wednesday' OR [DAYTYPE]='thursday' OR [DAYTYPE]='friday' OR [DAYTYPE]='saturday' OR [DAYTYPE]='weekend' OR [DAYTYPE]='workingholiday' OR [DAYTYPE]='weekday'

column.coldescr: The start of the date range for requests affected by this rule.
The end of the date range for requests affected by this rule.
Is Auto Processing for addition to Waitlist enabled? True/1 if it is, False/0 if not.

Decides which rule is enabled for Waitlists. Possible values are Yes - Auto waitlist requests with at least one violation, No - Do not auto waitlist any requests, Violation: Waitlist requests that violate any of the validation rules
Determines how the rule will be applied to this org and child orgs
Request Sub Type

The state of the Agent as defined in an ACD. This state is specified in messages (events) sent to or from the ACD.

Purpose of the Aux Code to drive certain actions. For example, when the user logs out, the cache is cleaned up.

What the aux code corresponds to in Activity Manager's shift operation. It may represent the start of a shift, or the end of a shift. There may not be a correspondence.

table.tabledescr: The Activity Message Translator uses this table to determine which aux code to send to a data source given the agent's current state and the new activity. An activity in the BP system is the combination of the Aux code ( lunch, etc.) and, in a number of cases (but not in all), the Agent Mode ( login/logout, etc).
table.tablenote: There can be many activites per data source and there can be many aux codes per activity. The agent's current state must allow a single aux code to be selected.,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

The bonus points assigned to the biddable schedule. The employee winning this schedule will get these bonus points. Bonus points incentivize employees to bid on schedules that may be less desirable.

The checksum value created by the standard MD5 hash algorithm dervied from component data values from different fields. Used to check if the contents of the component fields have changed in data. In this case components are shiftassignments, shifteventassignments and employee skills associated with this BiddableScheduleInstance. The hash value is used to check if the BiddableScheduleInstance components have changed in any way.

table.tabledescr: Actual calendar events assigned to Employees.
table.tablenote: Calendar Event Assignments may be produced from a template, such as for recurring events, but they need not be.,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
Primary key for a Table
Primary key for a Table
The start time of the calendar event on the schedule for the employee.
The Time Duration of the calendar event in minutes for the employee.
The date and time the calendar event assignment ends. Computed as the addition of the starttime plus the duration in minutes. De-normalized for performance.

When a number of events are layered on top of each other, or are contained within, the visibility of the event. Zero is at the bottom and the least visible. The highest number is the most visible. Two events of the same precedence cannot overlap.
Is the Calendar Event Assignment Locked? True/1 or False/0. If True, it cannot be moved by the scheduler.

How the calendar event is constrained in overlapping shifts: 0 - Event may not overlap shift, 1 - Event must overlap shift; that is, occur during a time in which the agent is scheduled for a shift, 2 - Event may overlap a shift and may occur regardless of shift overlaps.

The number code that specifies the type of calendar event: IMPORTED = 1, OVERRIDE = 2, CALENDAR_EVENT_ASSIGNMENT = 64, SHIFT_ASSIGNMENT = 128, SHIFT_EVENT_ASSIGNMENT = 256, EVENT_TYPE_TIME_OFF = 512, EVENT_TYPE_UNAVAILABILITY = 1024.
Number of minutes counted towards various rules such as vacation allocation, min/max hours, etc.
A number that indicates the method of calculating the minutes this event counts towards various rules. 1 - use underlying shift, 2 - use the value specified in COUNTSMINSTOWARDSRULES field.
Description of the calendar event
The name of the User who last updated this record
A number that changes/increases if the record is modified
Primary key for a Table

The start of the delta for this request. It includes any requested overtime.
It end of the delta for this request. It includes any requested overtime.
Is the main shift an overtime shift? 1=yes, 0=no. If this is a Sift change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the shift is requested.
The ID of the activity before the shift for this request. If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the activity before shift is requested.
Is the extension before shift for overtime? (1=yes, 0=no). If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the extension before shift is requested.

The number of gap minutes between the requested extension before shift and the shift. If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the extension before shift is requested.
The ID of the activity after the shift for this request. If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the activity after shift is requested.
Is the extension after shift for overtime? (1=yes, 0=no). If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the extension after shift is requested.

The number of gap minutes between the requested extension after shift and the shift. If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the extension after shift is requested.

For a Shift Change request, the Java hashCode of the scheduled ShiftAssignment object. This is used for determining if the request should be invalidated due to a change in the user's Shift Assignment after the request has been made but before it has been approved.
One of the following values: 1 (Regular New Shift), 2 (OT Net Swift), 3 (Regular Shift Change), 4 (OT Shift Change)
The number of minutes in the requested extension before shift. If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the extension before shift is requested.
The number of minutes in the requested extension after shift. If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the extension after shift is requested.
The start of the Shift for this request. If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the Shift is requested.
The end of the Shift for this request. If this is a Shift Change request, then this can be null, meaning that no change to the Shift is requested.

Is Historical Agent Adherence supported by this Data Source? Agent adherence data is normally communicated in real-time. As the agent does something on the phone, the ACD transmits the action to our system. Some ACDs can also store the action in a database for a few days. When the real time feed from a data source fails, the system will keep track of the start of the failure and the end of the failure. The system will try to run historical agent adherence to fill in the missing data. Not all data sources that support a real time feed, support history agent adherence.

table.tabledescr: Flag changes to data within group of database tables in a data area. Each record in this table tracks the state of changes made to one or more tables in the data area. Each tracked table must implement triggers for select, update and delete whose bodies increment the counters of all data areas that are tracking the table.
table.tablenote: Used to detect if a client-side cache that caches a group of tables needs to be updated. The data area's counter is recorded by the client each time the cache is synchronized with the data area. The client then watches/polls for changes to the counter in the database, synchronizing when there is a change. This table must be initialized with all the data areas that are being tracked, either in the new schema, or by the client.,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
The name given to the data area where changes are being tracked. A data area is a collection of one or more tables.
A number that changes/increases if any change (update, delete, insert) is made to any table being tracked in the data area.

keep the information about resume capability of a lesson. table.tabledescr: List of Lesson attempts. If any agent attempts a lesson, a record will be stored in this table.
table.tablenote: To be AICC compliant, this record will be updated every time the lesson communicates a PutParam with eLearning. The final PutParam will be the only valid one for that lesson attempt. A new Lesson Attempt will be created if the student attempts (start or restart) the lesson again, however, the same lesson attempt will be updated when the ""Resume"" button is clicked. The score of the last attempt is the valid score and this is repeated in the AICC.SCORE table too for easy access (No need to join two tables since the SCORE is accessed often).,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

table.tabledescr: The periodicity with which employees are paid: weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, etc.
table.tablenote: The use of the start date and the two rule-value pairs is to allow the administrator to set up the pay-period type flexibly for the whole enterprise. For example, if the startdate is 6/2/2001, the period is semi-monthly, the pay-day of the first payment = 10, the pay-day of the second payment is the end of the month (or pay-day is the 25th.) The payments generated for this are 6/2/2001-6/10/2001, 6/11/2001-6/25/2001, 6/26/2001-7/10/2001. The rule fields have values Rule1 = 1, Value1 = 10, Rule2 = 1, Value2 = 25 (or Rule2 = 0, Value2 = null). Current a rule can have two values: 0 says the pay day is the end of the month, and 1 says that the day of the month is in the value field. The other three types only need one rule.,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
A unique name for the pay period type: monthly (1), semi-monthly (2), weekly (3) and bi-weekly (4)
Description of the Pay Period Type
The internal code for the fixed type of pay period, primarily differentiated by peridocity: MONTHLY = 1, SEMIMONTHLY = 2, WEEKLY = 3, BIWEEKLY = 4
Date when the pay periods begin
Is this record marked as deleted? 1/Yes/True or 0/No/False.
The day in the month upto which payment must be made. Can be null if the value does not apply to the type of rule

States if the rule applies and has an associated value. If null, the rule does not apply. If 1, the rule applies and has a value that is the specific day of the month upto which payment must be made. If 0, applies and means that the payment is upto the last day of the period, and there is no explicit value. Rule Two currently applies only to the semi-monthly type and describes the second pay period of the month
The day in the month upto which payment must be made. Can be null if the value does not apply to the type of rule

States if the rule applies and has an associated value. If null, the rule does not apply. If 1, the rule applies and has a value that is the specific day of the month upto which payment must be made. If 0, the rule applies and the payment is upto the last day of the period, and there is no explicit value

If the employee takes a day off, the time in minutes the employee has not worked - the nominal amount of time an employee is presumed to work every day

Time Duration in Minutes within which the employee's activity start time should be rounded. For example, if 5 minutes, and the employee is to start at 9:00 AM, but arrives at 9:04 AM, the start time will be subject to rounding
Is this record marked as deleted? 1/Yes/True or 0/No/False.

How the rounding is to be done: 0 - Up, 1 - Down, 2 - Nearest. If rounding minutes is 5, and the start time is 9:00 AM, and the actual start is 9:04 AM, the start time will be adjusted as follows under the different methods: 0 - 9:05, 1 - 9:00, 2 - 9:05

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
The start time of an event
The end time of an event
If the event belongs to a shift, the start time of the shift in which this event belongs.
Is this a paid activity? If true, it must have an Earning Type.

Is this a Work Activity? True/1 if this activity represents primary work such as answering the phone. Only primary work activities may be assigned to whole shifts as well as to a work Shift Event Assignment.
Is this a Break Activity? True/1 if it can be used for non-work Shift Event Assignment.
Is this a Calendar Activity? True/1 if this activity is only for a calendar event such as meeting.
Is this an Unavailability Activity? True/1 if it represents that the resouce is not available to do primary work.

Time Duration in Minutes. Overrides the implied duration that is the difference between the planned event start and end times. A manager can override the paid hours of an employee's event to be different from the duration of the event.
Is this an Absence Activity? True/1 if this activity represents absence from work, including time off. If true, check the Is Allotment flag to see if the activity yearly hours allotment.

Are the scheduled events within this time range marked as overtime? True/1 if they are, False/0 otherwise.

Number code for a punch type. Start Activity = 0, Start Shift = 1, End Shift = 2. If end shift, this is entry is only a transition, there is no associated Activity, and ActivityID is null.

A more precise capture of the Raw Time Entry Punch Time with time precision to milliseconds. An integer in the form of YYYYMMDDHHIISSLLL where YYYY=year, MM=month, DD=day, HH=hour, II=minute, SS=second, LLL=milliseconds. The punch time is retained, albeit with lower precision, in date format, for ease of viewing and reporting.

The status of a raw time entry that represents the success or failure of the employee's punch-in to the system: Undetermined(0), Success(1), Warning(2), Failure(3). The Punch Error Message table will contain entries for all punches. The raw time entry table records only successful punches.

Number code representing the source for the raw time entry record. 0 - Time Collection, 1 - Manager, 2 - Schedule, 3 - Auto Close (done automatically to close an open shift), 4 - Auto Merge (done automatically to merge two timerecords so that a single day has a single timerecord) , 5 - My Time

When a role is associated to a role in a cluster,this attribute determines if public data from all the roles in cluster is populated in the instance data or just one. When value is 1 only one entry will be added to associated data. When value is 2 all entries from the cluster roles will be added to associated data.

paired associations, default is true

table.tabledescr: This table will contain the roles associations from the role metadata

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
The ID of the SERVERROLEMETADATA
This is the type of association. Its value will be one of the following. 0 for 1:1, 1 for 1:All, 2 for 1:N
This is the name of the associated role
This is the minimum version of the associated role
This is the maximum version of the associated role
This is the XPATH to the container element in this role's instance data
This is the scope of the constraint. 1 for enterprise, 2 for siteGroup, 3 for site, 4 for server
This indicates whether the association is a two way association
Based on the enforce value constraintvalidator gives error or warning.

1 will be the default value. EM will issue a warning/error depending on the enforce attribute, if the role is not associated to at least one instance of the role identified in the association 2 is optional, this is basically the opposite of required. EM will not issue any warning or errors related to this association 3 ifExists, for this one, EM will only issue a warning/error if the other role exists and is active and is not associated to the role which defined the association. Using the example above, EM would only issue the warning for the IS to Screen Recorder association if the Screen Recorder instance exists and is active.

When a role is associated to a role in a cluster, this attribute determines if public data from all the roles in cluster is populated in the instance data or just one. This will override the value specified in the SERVERROLEMETADATA table.

Based on the enforce value constraintvalidator gives error or warning.
Determines if multiple instances of a role should always be inside clusters. If 0 the condition will not be enforced.

The deadline for the completion of the Auction. Note that the deadline has to be earlier than the Shift Bid Auction Start Time.

Is the Shift Bid Auction only with Native Organization? True/1 if Bidder must belong to the Organization of the Phantom Employee associated with this Schedule (even though employees from multiple organizations have been added).
I the Shift Bid Auction implemented with Scoring Rules? True/1 if the auction uses scoring; False/0 if it uses random selection.
Number of Bouns points awarded if a bidder does not win any bids for the auction.

Number of bidders bidding for this auction. This equals the number of ShiftBidders associated with this auction with STATUS = ADDED or SUBMITTED.
The status of the Shift Bid Auction: CREATED = 1, OPEN = 2, CLOSED = 3, DONE = 4.

table.tabledescr: (one row per SPID, deleted when read by Forecast and Schedule) The purpose of this table is to send requests to the Forecast and Schedule. Similar to the SPSchedulerState used by the WebClient, this table will be checked regularly by the Forecast and Schedule because the Scheduler could choose to cancel at any time. Also, if the Forecast and Schedule is stopped because it has provided a list of warnings to the Web Client, we will wait for a request of Request or Cancel. Finally, the user can choose to stop and save schedule, and this will come as a request too.

column.coldescr: Primary Key
Alternate, auto-incrementing primary key for an DE table that will be a foreign key into an AM table to keep the foreign keys from AM of the AM variety.

Cancel -1, StopAndSave -1, Continue -2 Cancel State will be set when user chooses cancel from warning screen or main scheduling screen, Continue comes from Warning screen and Stop and Save comes from main Scheduling screen
The mode that the web calendar scheduler is running in. Currently the options are Schedule, Recalc and Analyze.

table.tabledescr: (one row per SPID) The purpose of this table will be to provide a single row that the WebClient will check on a timer to check the F AND S status of the scheduler run. This table will be Written to and Updated by the F AND S, and will be Read from with a Final Delete by the WebClient. It will contain progress bar status information for both a status flag for the overall scheduler run, and the current scheduler cycle (or pass). There will also be a flag to specify if there are a set of warnings that F AND S is awaiting a response from the F AND S. And, a flag to indicate if WebClient should enable its Stop and Save Schedule button.

column.coldescr: Primary Key
Alternate, auto-incrementing primary key for an DE table that will be a foreign key into an AM table to keep the foreign keys from AM of the AM variety.
Over all Status
Current Status
Status of the message index
Warnings Flag
Enable stop and save button
Last updated time stamp
The mode that the web calendar scheduler is running in. Currently the options are Schedule, Recalc and Analyze.

table.tabledescr: This table will be used by the F AND S to provide localized strings to the Web Client. If there are warning, which the F AND S will be notified of by a flag in SPSchedulerState, the F AND S will have written the set, one per row, to the SPSchedulerWarnings table. If there are status messages, and these will be written fairly frequently, the F AND S will write these messages to SPSchedulerStatusMsgs. will keep a counter in the SPSchedulerState table so WebClient will know if there has been an update, and write these messages to SPSchedulerStatusMsgs. These will be written to the main screen of the Scheduler status for the Web Client.

column.coldescr: Primary Key

To represent message status

How employees are ranked for assigning preferred shifts - by seniority only (2), by assigned rank only(1), by both (3), or preferences are not used (0)

Favor understaffing vs. overstaffing to meet agent requirements when an exact match is not possible. Default 5, ranges from 0 (prefer understaffing) to 10 (prefer overstaffing)

table.tabledescr: This table will be used by the F AND S to provide localized strings to the Web Client. If there are warning, which the F AND S will be notified of by a flag in SPSchedulerState, the F AND S will have written the set, one per row, to the SPSchedulerWarnings table. If there are status messages, and these will be written fairly frequently, the F AND S will write these messages to SPSchedulerStatusMsgs. will keep a counter in the SPSchedulerState table so WebClient will know if there has been an update, and write these messages to SPSchedulerStatusMsgs. These will be written to the main screen of the Scheduler status for the Web Client.

table.tabledescr: The Shrinkage applied to Employees in Campaign Weeks. Shrinkage is the time lost to vacations, absenttism, adherence violations and the water fountain.
table.tablenote: In 4.6 and earlier versions, Shrinkage included both of these factors. However, call center supervisors had control over vacations, absenteeism, adherence violations, and water fountain time, but do not have any direct control over modeling value, so we have decided to break them into two columns. Note that the Model Value columns exist for each of the 24 hours, upto number 23 not shown on this page.,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

column.coldescr: Primary key column for PTE tables
Primary key column for PTE tables
The index of the day in the period for which Shrinkage is defined, starting with 0.

Determines whether the Modeling Value data is entered by the user as hourly or daily. True/1 if the Model Value is entered as hourly, False/0 if entered as daily. The values are always stored as hourly - this flag is only for the UI.

Determines whether the Shrinkage Percentage data is entered by the user as hourly or daily. True/1 if it is entered as hourly, False/0 if entered as daily. The values are always stored as hourly - this flag is only for the UI.

Shrinkage forecast/estimated for the indicated time period. Shrinkage is the percentage of the total number of agents who are not on the phone as scheduled. This includes absent agents as well as agents taking unscheduled breaks. The system compensates for shrinkage by scheduling more agents.

Modeling Value expressed as a positive or negative percentage to get the system prediction calibrated to historical values. This is needed due to differences between the internal model and the real world. Applies to the hour offset.

Alternate, auto-incrementing primary key for an DE table that will be a foreign key into an AM table to keep the foreign keys from AM of the AM variety.

The start time of the time range dumped for the queue.
The end time of the time range dumped for the queue.

table.tabledescr: Combine trace values from different tables, and convert from wide to narrow time, for ease of reporting.
table.tablenote: If the report is for a real queue, QueueID is not null. If the report is for a combined queue, QueueID is null. The MediaID and CampaignID are not null for Media Combined Queues for Campaigns. If both MediaID and QueueID are null and CampaignID is not null, the report is for all Medias and Queues in the Campaign.,,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

Alternate, auto-incrementing primary key for an DE table that will be a foreign key into an AM table to keep the foreign keys from AM of the AM variety. The default value represents the custom null value.

The Suite Identifier alternate key referenced by AM tables. Since no new user-created rows can be inserted, this key is non-auto-incrementing and is specified in the initial data. The default value represents the custom null value.
Trace value for the Contact Volume timeseries measure. Call Volume is the number of calls received in the 15-minute interval.
Trace value for the Average Handling Time timeseries measure. The average time, in seconds, an agent spent on a contact in the 15-minute interval.
Trace value for the Percent Calls Answered timeseries measure. This is the percentage of calls arrived in this interval that were eventually answered within a specified Service Goal Time Threshold.
Trace value for the Average Speed-to-Answer timeseries measure. This is the time taken to respond to the contact after it arrives at the call center.

Trace value for the Abandonment timeseries measure. The number of callers that hung up in the 15-minute inteval before their call was answered by an agent. Applies only to non-deferred communication media such as phone.
Trace value for the Backlog timeseries measure. Backlog applies to deferred media such as e-mail, and expressed as the number of incoming messages that have yet to be answered.

Trace value for the Staffing timeseries measure. Average agent staffing in the 15-minute interval. This is the number of agents working on the queue in the time interval. ACDs will typically report the number at the end of the interval.
Trace value for the Occupancy timeseries measure. Average Occupancy is the percentage of time agents spend on contacts during the 15-minute time interval.

Trace value for the Staffing FTE (full-time-equivalents) timeseries measure. Average agent staffing in the 15-minute interval. This is the number of agents working on the queue in the time interval. ACDs will typically report the number at the end of the interval.
Trace value for the Contact Volume timeseries measure. Call Volume is the number of calls received in the 15-minute interval.
Trace value for the Average Handling Time timeseries measure. The average time, in seconds, an agent spent on a contact in the 15-minute interval.
Trace value for the Percent Calls Answered timeseries measure. This is the percentage of calls arrived in this interval that were eventually answered within a specified Service Goal Time Threshold.
Trace value for the Average Speed-to-Answer timeseries measure. This is the time taken to respond to the contact after it arrives at the call center.

Trace value for the Abandonment timeseries measure. The number of callers that hung up in the 15-minute inteval before their call was answered by an agent. Applies only to non-deferred communication media such as phone.
Trace value for the Backlog timeseries measure. Backlog applies to deferred media such as e-mail, and expressed as the number of incoming messages that have yet to be answered.

Trace value for the Staffing timeseries measure. Average agent staffing in the 15-minute interval. This is the number of agents working on the queue in the time interval. ACDs will typically report the number at the end of the interval.
Trace value for the Occupancy timeseries measure. Average Occupancy is the percentage of time agents spend on contacts during the 15-minute time interval.

Trace value for the Forecasted Staffing FTE (full-time-equivalents) timeseries measure. Average agent staffing in the 15-minute interval. This is the number of agents working on the queue in the time interval. ACDs will typically report the number at the end of the interval.
Trace value for the Percent Calls Answered timeseries measure. This is the percentage of calls arrived in this interval that were eventually answered within a specified Service Goal Time Threshold.
Trace value for the Average Speed-to-Answer timeseries measure. This is the time taken to respond to the contact after it arrives at the call center.

Trace value for the Abandonment timeseries measure. The number of callers that hung up in the 15-minute inteval before their call was answered by an agent. Applies only to non-deferred communication media such as phone.

Trace value for the Required Staffing FTE (full-time-equivalents) timeseries measure. Average agent staffing in the 15-minute interval. This is the number of agents working on the queue in the time interval. ACDs will typically report the number at the end of the interval.

table.tabledescr: This table provides generic translation of text in specific varchar columns in specific tables. The string in the specified language

Maximum Voluntary Time-off Hours per Week.

Start of an effectivity time period. Effectivity implies that there are other records for different non-overlapping time periods.
End of an effectivity time period. Effectivity implies that there are other records for different non-overlapping time periods.
A factor of average handle time ranging from 0-10. One is an average proficiency. A number less than one is more proficient; greater than one is less proficient

table.tabledescr: Skills posessed by Work Resources

column.coldescr: Primary key column for PTE tables
This ID column represents ID from EMPLOYEEAM table
Primary key column for PTE tables
Proficiency level for the skill. The average proficiency is 1. A number less than 1 is more proficient; greater than one is less proficient. The range is 1-10

Numerical rating that determines how call routing between agents with various skills is simulated after scheduling shifts. For example, if two or more agents are available, the contact is assigned to the agent with the highest priority
The date on which it was determined that the EMPLOYEE possesses the SKILL.
The day on which it was determined that the EMPLOYEE no longer has a sufficient level of the SKILL

When an agent is setup to handle calls for a queue that is not his/her primary queue, this number indicates the level to which the call flows down for this agent for a call received in this queue, skill being a proxy for the queue.

table.tabledescr: Rules by which employees must work, and according to which they are compensated.

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
Name given to a work rule
The date and time a work rules becomes effective
Date and time after which the work rule is no longer effective
The time unit for the work rule period represented by number: day (0), week(1), month(2), year (3)
The number of units in a work rule period

The relative importance of a rule. In a scheduling context, it tells us which rules can be broken, if necessary, to satisfy other rules. In a pay policy context, it tells us which rule gives the overtime wage rate if multiple rules are being violated simultaneously

If this is a payroll-related rule, the quantity of money or minutes (determinted by the adjustment unit of earning type) adjusted by the rule. If the rule is not payroll-related, this column should not be set

Primary key for a Table

table.tabledescr: Pay Rule Alerts when a Pay Period is Posted.
table.tablenote: This data is used for reporting and historical consistency when viewing posted Pay Periods. These conflicts can be reported, for example, as: [Employee: John Smith is triggering OT1 Pay Rule: More than 8 hours per day from Oct 22 6:00 PM to Oct 22 7:00 PM],,2014-02-25 18:23:09 UTC

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
This ID column represents ID from EMPLOYEEAM table
Primary key for a Table
Primary key for a Table
The amount of pay given as a consequence of triggering a work rule.
The starting date and time of the employee's original activity that triggered the pay rule alert.
The ending date and time of the employee's original activity that triggered the pay rule alert.
The description of the original rule that triggered the alert, such as OT1 Pay Rule: More than 8 hours per day.

table.tabledescr: Actual parameter values used in a specific work-rule.

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table

A Number that defines which type of parameter this is - one of the enumeration of all possible types for work rule parameters: Sequence (0), Integer (1), Float(2), Time(3), Clause(4), Week(5), Activity(6), Activity Category(7)
The sequence of the parameter in a work-rule whose value is being specified
If this record is for specifying the value of an integer parameter, the integer value
If this record is for specifying the value of an float or double parameter, the floating value
If this value is for a parameter that specifies time, the offset in minutes from midnight within a day.
If this record is for specifying the value of an clause number parameter, the clause number value
Number representing day of the week. Represented by Sunday = 1, Monday = 2, ...., Saturday = 7 corresponding to the Java Calendar Class. This mapping is also in table WEEKDAY
The various parts of a day: 0 - AnyTime, 1 - Morning, 2 - Afternoon, 3 - Evening, 4 - Night.

table.tabledescr: Template to stamp out a work rule. A template is the structure of a rule without the parameters. The system comes with predefined or built-in templates that are registered in this table, with the capability of adding custom templates.

column.coldescr: Primary key for a Table
Name of the work-rule template
The XML text of the work rule that for this template
Is this template built-in to the system? True/1 or False/0. Custom templates have this flag set to 0, the default

True/1 or False/0. This boolean describes whether rules created from this template are pay rules or assignment rules. For example, [Employees who work between 40 and 60 hours per week are paid OT1] is a pay rule while [Employee must work between 40 and 60 hours per week] is an assignment rule

This boolean describes whether rules created fromt his template have periods associated with them. For example [Employees who work between 40 and 60 hours per week are paid OT1] has a period of 1 week. While [Employees who work between 7 and 10 consecutive days are paid OT1] has no period associated with it
Is this work rule supported/used by the scheduler? True/1 or False/0
An external function name that is invoked to compute a custom work rule

table.tabledescr: The time period of the employee's work on which the assignment rule is based.

Employee's time period unit of work is a shift (0), day(1), day of week (2), partial weekend (5), full weekend (4) or hour(3)
This value is meaningful only when work unit type is "day of week" - represents the "day of the week" with Monday 1 to Sunday 7.
One of paid, unpaid, on phone. Defined when work unit type is "hour"

Primary key column for PTE tables

The start time window in minutes from midnight where shifts are counted towards the period.
The end time window in minutes from midnight where shifts are counted towards the period
